summary: THE FUEL GAUGE SHOWS THAT THE TRUCK IS ON EMPTY WHICH ALSO MAKES THE LOW FUEL LIGHT TO COME ON.  THE TRUCK HAS EITHER A FULL TANK OF GAS OR HAS PLENTY OF GAS.  THE DEALERSHIP SAID IT WAS A PROBLEM WITH THE FUEL SENSOR AND ACTED LIKE IT IS VERY COMMON.  I HAVE ALSO TALKED TO OTHER OWNERS THAT HAVE THE SAME COMPLAINT.*AK
